item.title: Wendy add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "So far, about morals, I know only that what is moral is what you feel good after and what is immoral is what you feel bad after." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "It is good to have an end to journey toward; but it is the journey that matters, in the end." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "When people talk, listen completely. Most people never listen." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "My aim is to put down on paper what I see and what I feel in the best and simplest way." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "I love sleep. My life has the tendency to fall apart when I'm awake, you know?" -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "If you are lucky enough to have lived in Paris as a young man, then wherever you go for the rest of your life, it stays with you, for Paris is a moveable feast." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "It's none of their business that you have to learn how to write. Let them think you were born that way." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing noble in being superior to your fellow man; true nobility is being superior to your former self." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "If people bring so much courage to this world the world has to kill them to break them, so of course it kills them. The world breaks every one and afterward many are strong at the broken places. But those that will not break it kills. It kills the very good and the very gentle and the very brave impartially. If you are none of these you can be sure it will kill you too but there will be no special hurry." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Poor Faulkner. Does he really think big emotions come from big words? He thinks I donâ€™t know the ten-dollar words. I know them all right. But there are older and simpler and better words, and those are the ones I use." -- Ernest Hemingway
